Armor.name: Light Armor
Armor.special: Wearing light armor increases the TN of all Athletic and Stealth rolls by 5.

Armor.name: Heavy Armor
Armor.special: Wearing heavy armor increases the TN of all skill rolls using Agility and Reflexes by 5.

Armor.name: Tetsu-do
Armor.special: Iron armor is considered heavy armor for the purposes of mechanical effects that specify armor type, including Techniques, Advantages, etc. Wearing iron armor increases the TN of all Skill Rolls using Agility or Reflexes by +10; if the wearer has a Strength of 5 or higher, the penalty is only +5 instead.

Armor.name: Riding armor
Armor.special: Wearing riding armor increases the TN of all skill rolls using Agility and Reflexes by 5, except on horseback.

Arrows.name: Armor-piercing
Arrows.special: Ignores Bonus to Armor TN from armor.

Arrows.name: Flesh Cutter
Arrows.special: Doubles Bonus to Armor TN from armor; half range.

Arrows.name: Rope Cutter
Arrows.special: Grants two Raises on call shots towards inanimate objects; half range.

Bows.name: Dai-kyu
Bows.special: Increases TN of all attack rolls by 10 on foot.

Bows.name: Han-kyu
Bows.special: Increases TN of all attack rolls by 10 on horseback.

Bows.name: Yumi
Bows.special: Increases TN of all attack rolls by 10 on horseback.

Chain weapons.name: Kyoketsu-shogi
Chain weapons.special: Doubles Bonus to Armor TN from armor.

Ninja weapons.name: Blowgun
Ninja weapons.special: Triples Bonus to Armor TN from armor. Damages increase to 1k1 then 2k1 at Ninjutsu 3/7.

Ninja weapons.name: Shuriken
Ninja weapons.special: Can be thrown up to 25' as a ranged weapon.

Ninja weapons.name: Tsubute
Ninja weapons.special: Can be thrown up to 30' as a ranged weapon.

Polearms.name: Sasumata
Polearms.special: Can be used to initiate a grapple.

Polearms.name: Sadegarami
Polearms.special: Can be used to initiate a grapple.

Spears.name: Kumade
Spears.special: Breaks if inflicts 25 or more damage.

Spears.name: Mai chong
Spears.special: Can be thrown up to 25' as a ranged weapon.

Spears.name: Lance
Spears.special: Damage reduced to 1k2 when not charging on horseback. Using without charging imposes a penality of 5 on horseback and 10 on foot. Breaks if inflicts 30 or more damage.

Spears.name: Nage-yari
Spears.special: Can be thrown up to 50' as a ranged weapon.

Spears.name: Yari
Spears.special: Can be thrown up to 50' as a ranged weapon. Damage rating when thrown is 1k2.

Swords.name: Bokken
Swords.special: Reduction from armor is doubled against a bokken.

Swords.name: Katana
Swords.special: Can spend a void point to increase damage by 1k1.

Swords.name: Ninja-to
Swords.special: Counts as small for concealment. Breaks if inflicts 40 or more damage.

Swords.name: Parangu
Swords.special: Breaks if inflicts 30 or more damage.

Swords.name: Shinai
Swords.special: A shinai’s damage dice cannot explode.

Swords.name: Wakizashi
Swords.special: Can be thrown up to 20' as a ranged weapon.

Rokugani Firearms.name: Kakiyari (Fire Lance)
Rokugani Firearms.special: The Fire Lance can be wielded in melee as a Yari. If so, its DR is 1k1 and it cannot be thrown accurately. A normal Fire Lance such as this can only be fired once.

Rokugani Firearms.name: Bo-Hiya (Fire Arrows)
Rokugani Firearms.special: Fire Arrows explode when they land. Their damage ignores all forms of Reduction.

Rokugani Firearms.name: Hand-Cannon
Rokugani Firearms.special: The Hand-Cannon ignores Reduction from natural toughness. It can only be fired once. The Hand-Cannon can be wielded in melee as a Tetsubo.

Rokugani Firearms.name: Bajozutsu
Rokugani Firearms.cost: Due to the sacred nature of the Bajozutsu and the complexity of the weapon’s manufacture, they are not normally available for sale.
Rokugani Firearms.special: The Bajozutsu can be drawn from its sheath with the Iaijutsu skill.

Rokugani Firearms.name: Teppo
Rokugani Firearms.special: At half range or less, the Teppo ignores Reduction from natural toughness.
